s.text: Regarding the May 21 "Today's Papers": If Richard Nixon's "but it would be wrong" is really the classic example of what Safire calls "tickling the wire," how do you explain the fact that no hush money was raised or paid as a result of the March 1973 Watergate-era tape to which you refer?
In addition to reading the inner workings of my heart as it relates to tax rates for married couples, Rob McIntyre ("E-Mail to the Editors," May 7) takes issue with my arithmetic.
In addition to reading the inner workings of my heart as it relates to tax rates for married couples, Rob McIntyre ("E-Mail to the Editors," May 7) takes issue with my arithmetic.
I do know, however, that my numbers have a source that has nothing to do with my admittedly arthritic arithmetic skills.
How long have birth control pills been available by prescription?
How long have birth control pills been available by prescription?

Though it may be inefficient, I think it reasonable that each locality can set the legal conditions of its own economic life, as American states do with regard to taxation, infrastructure, and a thousand other economic issues.
